thread.title: Apostle Island Relay Swim, National Championship Musky Open, Venetian Festival
thread.title_full: Apostle Island Relay Swim, National Championship Musky Open, Venetian Festival

title: Apostle Island Relay Swim, National Championship Musky Open, Venetian Festival
text:
Apostle Island Relay Swim, National Championship Musky Open, Venetian Festival By Chelsey Lewis of the Journal Sentinel Aug. 16, 2015 6:00 a.m. (0) Comments 
Bayfield: Apostle Island Relay Swim. Swimmers will brave the chilly waters of Lake Superior for this 20-mile solo or team swim event around Madeline Island on Saturday. The event begins in La Pointe and lasts from dawn until dusk; most competitors finish by midafternoon. See apostleislandrelayswim.com . 
Delavan: Shake the Lake. Groove along Delavan Lake at this music festival Friday through next Sunday at Lake Lawn Resort, 2400 E. Geneva St. Performers include country band Bella Cain on Friday, Southern Drawl on Saturday and the Boat Drunks next Sunday. Tickets are $10 per day or $25 for the weekend. See lakelawnresort.com . 
Eagle River: National Championship Musky Open. Landing a mighty musky is at the top of many anglers' bucket lists, and they'll have the chance to do that at this amateur tournament Friday through next Sunday on seven lake families in Vilas County. The Vilas County Fairgrounds on Highway 70 West will serve as tournament headquarters. The tournament entry fee is $65. See eagleriver.org . 
Lake Geneva: Venetian Festival. A lighted boat parade is the literal highlight of this 53rd annual festival put on by the Lake Geneva Jaycees. The parade begins at dusk next Sunday in front of Library Park on Geneva Lake and will be followed by fireworks. The rest of the festival takes place from Wednesday through next Sunday and includes a carnival, a craft fair, food and drinks, live music and a water-ski show. See venetianfest.com . 
Potosi: Brewfest. Taste beer, wine and specialty meats and cheeses from 60 vendors at this festival from 1 to 5 p.m. Saturday at the Holiday Gardens Event Center, 101 Brewery Hollow Road. Visitors can also enjoy music, food and games and take part in a beer stein holding contest. Tickets are $45; attendees must be 21 and older. See potosibrewery.com . 
Superior: Lake Superior Dragon Boat Festival. Cheer on paddlers as they race dragon boats on Lake Superior on Friday and Saturday. Races take place from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturday, when visitors can also peruse a craft fair, enjoy live music and attend an after-party at the Barkers Island Inn. Friday's festivities include a team parade, fireworks and live music. The festival takes place on Barker's Island. See lakesuperiordragons.com. 
Illinois: State Fair. If you didn't get your fair fix in Wisconsin, head south to Springfield to enjoy this state fair through next Sunday. From carnival rides and fair food to livestock shows and live music, there's something for everyone. Admission is $7 for adults, $3 for children ages 5 to 12 and those age 60 and older, and free for kids under 5. See illinois.gov/statefair . 
Michigan: Mackinac Island Fudge Festival. Indulge your fudge cravings at this festival Friday through next Sunday on Mackinac Island. Activities include fudge-making demonstrations, fudge giveaways, a fudge-inspired dinner, a sugar relay race, beer tastings and more. See mackinacisland.org . 
— Chelsey Lewis 
Please send notice of events three weeks in advance to: All Over the Map, Travel Section, P.O. Box 371, Milwaukee, WI 53201 or to jsfeat@journalsentinel.com, with All Over the Map as the subject. © 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved. About Chelsey Lewis 
Chelsey Lewis writes about travel and things to do in Wisconsin for Wisconsin Trails and the Journal Sentinel.
